text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus graciliformis (also known as the Chisos oak or slender oak) is a rare North American species of oak tree in the beech family.
text.Description: Quercus graciliformis is a deciduous tree up to 8 metres (26 ft) tall. Leaves are elliptical or lance-shaped with 8-10 shallow lobes. The acorns are produced biennially.
text.Distribution:
The species has been found only in the Chisos Mountains, within Big Bend National Park of West Texas, and a few miles southeast into the state of Coahuila in northeast Mexico. It is threatened by habitat loss.It grows on dry, rocky canyon floors at elevations above 5,000 feet (1,500 m).
